name: Construire un pipeline de traitement de documents RAG agentique multi-client avec Supabase Vector DB
description:
# Modèle RAG Agentique ultime n8n

**Auteur :** [Cole Medin](https://www.youtube.com/@ColeMedin)

## Qu'est-ce que c'est ?
Ce modèle fournit une mise en œuvre complète d'un système **RAG agentique (Génération Augmentée par Récupération)** dans n8n qui peut être facilement étendu pour votre cas d'utilisation spécifique et votre base de connaissances. Contrairement au RAG standard qui ne réalise que des recherches simples, cet agent peut raisonner sur votre base de connaissances, s'améliorer lui-même en matière de récupération et passer dynamiquement d'un outil à un autre en fonction de la question spécifique.

## Pourquoi RAG agentique ?
Le RAG standard a des limitations significatives :
- Mauvaise analyse des données numériques/tabulaires
- Contexte manquant en raison du découpage des documents
- Incapacité à connecter des informations à travers les documents
- Pas de sélection d'outil dynamique en fonction du type de question

## Ce qui rend ce modèle puissant :
- **Sélection d'outil intelligente** : Passe d'une recherche RAG, de requêtes SQL ou de récupération de documents complets en fonction de la question
- **Contexte complet des documents** : Accède à des documents entiers lorsque nécessaire au lieu de simples morceaux
- **Analyse numérique précise** : Utilise SQL pour des calculs précis sur des données de tableur/tabulaire
- **Perspectives inter-documents** : Connecte des informations à travers l'ensemble de votre base de connaissances
- **Traitement multi-fichiers** : Gère plusieurs documents dans une seule boucle de flux de travail
- **Stockage efficace** : Utilise JSONB dans Supabase pour stocker des données tabulaires sans créer de nouvelles tables pour chaque CSV

## Pour commencer
1. Exécutez d'abord les nœuds de création de table pour configurer vos tables de base de données dans Supabase
2. Téléchargez vos documents via Google Drive (ou remplacez par une autre solution de stockage de fichiers)
3. L'agent les traitera automatiquement (découpage de texte, stockage de données tabulaires dans Supabase)
4. Commencez à poser des questions qui tirent parti des multiples approches de raisonnement de l'agent

## Personnalisation
Ce modèle fournit une base solide que vous pouvez étendre en :
- Ajustant l'invite système pour votre cas d'utilisation spécifique
- Ajoutant des métadonnées de document comme des résumés
- Mettant en œuvre des techniques RAG plus avancées
- Optimisant pour des bases de connaissances plus grandes

---

J'ai l'intention de créer une version locale de cet agent très bientôt !

parameters.query:
CREATE TABLE {{ $('When chat message received').item.json.chatInput }}_document_metadata (
    id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    title TEXT,
    url TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
    schema TEXT
);

nodes.name: Create Document Rows Table (for Tabular Data)1
Create Documents Table and Match Function1

parameters.query:
-- Create a table to store your documents
CREATE TABLE {{ $json.chatInput }}_documents (
  id bigserial primary key,
  content text, -- corresponds to Document.pageContent
  metadata jsonb, -- corresponds to Document.metadata
  embedding vector(1536) -- 1536 works for OpenAI embeddings, change if needed
);

-- Create an index for better performance
CREATE INDEX {{ $json.chatInput }}_documents_embedding_idx 
ON {{ $json.chatInput }}_documents 
USING ivfflat (embedding vector_cosine_ops);

-- Create a function to search for documents
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION match_{{ $json.chatInput }}_documents (
  query_embedding vector(1536),
  match_count int DEFAULT 10,
  filter jsonb DEFAULT '{}'
)
RETURNS TABLE (
  id bigint,
  content text,
  metadata jsonb,
  similarity float
)
LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $$
BEGIN
  RETURN QUERY
  SELECT
    doc.id,
    doc.content,
    doc.metadata,
    1 - (doc.embedding <=> query_embedding) as similarity
  FROM {{ $('Chercher nom dernier client').item.json['Dernier client'] }}_documents doc
  WHERE 
    CASE 
      WHEN filter != '{}' THEN doc.metadata @> filter
      ELSE TRUE
    END
  ORDER BY doc.embedding <=> query_embedding
  LIMIT match_count;
END;
$$;

-- Grant permissions
GRANT EXECUTE ON FUNCTION match_{{ $json.chatInput }}_documents TO authenticated;
GRANT EXECUTE ON FUNCTION match_{{ $json.chatInput }}_documents TO anon;

parameters.content:
### What you do:
Provide the client name or identifier via chat interface to initialize their dedicated database tables
Ensure the client name follows proper naming conventions (no spaces, special characters)
Confirm the client requires a separate vector database instance for data isolation

### What the system does:
Creates client-specific PostgreSQL tables with pgvector extension for isolated vector storage
Establishes dedicated document metadata table with client-specific naming convention
Sets up client-specific document rows table for tabular data storage (spreadsheets, CSV files)
Creates custom match function for similarity search operations using client-specific table names
Configures separate Supabase integration for each client's vector storage and retrieval operations

**Database Tables Created:**
- `[client_name]_documents`: Vector storage with embeddings and metadata
- `[client_name]_document_metadata`: Document tracking with titles, URLs, schemas
- `[client_name]_document_rows`: Tabular data storage for spreadsheets/CSV files
- `match_[client_name]_documents()`: Custom search function for semantic queries

### Result:
✅ Isolated vector database infrastructure established per client
✅ Complete data separation ensuring client confidentiality
✅ Multi-format document support enabled for each client instance
✅ Custom search capabilities activated per client database
✅ Scalable multi-tenant architecture ready for document processing
# Phase 2: Google Drive Folder Monitoring Configuration

### What you do:
Configure the Google Drive folder URL for monitoring specific client document repositories
Update the folder path in both "File Created" and "File Updated" trigger nodes
Ensure proper Google Drive API permissions for file access and monitoring
Verify the Supabase vector store node points to the correct client-specific table name

### What the system does:
Monitors specified Google Drive folder for new file uploads and existing file updates
Triggers workflow execution automatically when documents are created or modified
Handles multiple file types including PDF, Google Docs, Sheets, Excel, and CSV files
Implements dual triggers for both file creation and update events ensuring comprehensive coverage
Processes files individually to maintain data integrity and prevent cross-client contamination

**Critical Configuration Requirements:**
- Update folder URL in both trigger nodes to match client's document repository
- Modify "Insert into Supabase Vectorstore" node table name to `[client_name]_documents`
- Ensure all database operations reference correct client-specific table names

### Result:
✅ Real-time document monitoring for client-specific Google Drive folders
✅ Automatic processing of new and updated documents with proper client isolation
✅ Multi-format file support for comprehensive document management
✅ Reliable trigger system ensuring no client documents are missed
✅ Scalable monitoring infrastructure supporting multiple client instances
# Phase 3: Document Processing and Content Extraction

### What the system does:
Downloads documents from Google Drive using secure API connections with client context
Identifies file types automatically and routes to appropriate extraction methods
Processes PDF files with text extraction preserving structure and formatting
Handles Google Docs conversion to plain text format for optimal AI processing
Extracts data from Excel and CSV files with schema detection and preservation
Implements comprehensive error handling for corrupted or inaccessible documents

**Multi-Format Processing Capabilities:**
- PDF documents: Full text extraction with formatting preservation
- Google Docs: Native conversion to structured text format
- Excel/Google Sheets: Data extraction with automatic column schema detection
- CSV files: Structured data processing with intelligent delimiter detection

### Result:
✅ Comprehensive content extraction across all major document formats
✅ Structured data preservation for spreadsheets and tabular client content
✅ Clean text formatting optimized for AI processing and vector embedding generation
✅ Robust error handling ensuring workflow stability across diverse document types
✅ Schema detection enabling intelligent data organization for each client
# Phase 4: Data Aggregation and Schema Management

### What the system does:
Aggregates extracted data from Excel and CSV files for comprehensive processing
Concatenates structured data while preserving individual record integrity
Summarizes tabular data by combining all rows into a unified format for vector processing
Stores individual table rows in client-specific PostgreSQL database for structured queries
Creates and updates schema metadata for spreadsheet and CSV file structures
Maps column structures and data types for intelligent data organization per client

**Data Processing Operations:**
- "Aggregate": Combines all extracted data items into consolidated format
- "Summarize": Concatenates field data while maintaining structure
- "Insert Table Rows": Stores individual rows in `[client_name]_document_rows` table
- "Set Schema": Captures column structure and data types from spreadsheets/CSV
- "Update Schema for Document Metadata": Updates client metadata with schema information

### Result:
✅ Structured data properly aggregated for vector embedding processing
✅ Individual table rows preserved for detailed structured queries
✅ Schema information captured enabling intelligent data organization
✅ Client-specific tabular data storage with full query capabilities
✅ Data structure metadata maintained for enhanced search and filtering
# Phase 5: Advanced Vector Embedding and Text Processing

### What the system does:
Processes aggregated text content using OpenAI embeddings for semantic search capabilities
Implements character-based text splitting to maintain context while optimizing chunk sizes
Generates high-dimensional vector representations (1536 dimensions) for similarity search
Loads processed documents with proper metadata attribution for client identification
Configures embedding model parameters optimized for document content and search performance

**Vector Processing Components:**
- "Embeddings OpenAI": Generates semantic embeddings using text-embedding-3-small model
- "Character Text Splitter": Intelligently segments text maintaining contextual coherence
- "Default Data Loader": Loads processed content with client-specific metadata tags
- Metadata preservation including file_id and file_title for document traceability

### Result:
✅ High-quality semantic embeddings optimized for client-specific document search
✅ Intelligent text segmentation preserving document meaning and context
✅ Proper metadata attribution enabling document traceability and client isolation
✅ Search-optimized vector representations supporting similarity queries
✅ Scalable embedding generation supporting large document collections per client

# Phase 6: Client-Specific Vector Database Storage and Workflow Completion

### What the system does:
Stores processed vector embeddings in client-specific Supabase database tables
Inserts document vectors with associated metadata into `[client_name]_documents` table
Completes the document processing cycle and returns to monitoring loop for additional files
Maintains data integrity through proper client-specific table targeting
Enables immediate semantic search capabilities within client's isolated vector database

**Critical Configuration Requirement:**
- **IMPORTANT**: Update "Insert into Supabase Vectorstore" node to reference correct client table name
- Change table name from generic "documents" to `[client_name]_documents`
- Ensure vector storage targets the client-specific table created in Phase 1

### Result:
✅ Vector embeddings securely stored in client-specific database tables
✅ Immediate semantic search capabilities activated for client document collection
✅ Complete workflow cycle enabling continuous document processing and monitoring
✅ Client data isolation maintained through proper table targeting
✅ Scalable vector storage supporting unlimited document processing per client instance

## Need more advanced automation solutions? Contact us for custom enterprise workflows!

# Growth-AI.fr
